data.event: Incorporated in 1836, the city of Lexington was founded by European-American settlers after the Choctaw people were forced to cede their land to the United States and remove to the Indian Territory.
On court days, the town served as a trading center for the county and attracted retail merchants who set up shop in the town.

event.title: were joined later in the century

data.event: They were joined later in the century by Russian Jewish immigrants.

event.title: built Temple Beth El in Lexington in 1905

data.event: The community built Temple Beth El in Lexington in 1905; it closed in 2009 because of declining population.
